name: Laura Bocchi
content: Laura Bocchi - School of Computing - University of Kent Jump to content design1 Dr Laura Bocchi Reader in Computing Research group head (PLAS) Email l.bocchi@kent.ac.uk Telephone +44 (0)1227 82 7591 More information Go to google-scholar ORCID iD: 0000-0002-7177-9395 Location Room 208 Kennedy Building University of Kent Canterbury Kent CT2 7FS On this page About Research interests Teaching Professional About Laura's research focuses on theories and tools for developing safe distributed systems, in particular on the theory and application of behavioural types. Laura has been working on the extension of Multiparty Session Types with logics to enable Design by Contract for concurrency, with time constraints to enable effective verification of real-time and reliable distributed systems. Research interests I belong to the following research groups:Programming Languages and Systems GroupMoreover, I am Associate Member of the Kent Interdisciplinary Research Centre in Cyber Security (KirCCS), and a collaborator of the Mobility Reading Group where I am contributing to extending Scribble with assertions and time. Teaching COMP8870 -- Web-Based Information Systems DevelopmentCOMP6610 -- Theory and Practice of Concurrency (convenor) Professional Here is list of projects I am or was involved in:STARDUST — EPSRC standard grant    BEHAPI -- H2020 Marie Sklodowska-Curie RISE projectTime-sensitive protocol design and implementation -- EPSRC first grantBETTY -- Behavioural Types for Reliable Large-Scale Software SystemsABCD -- A Basis for Concurrency and DistributionOOI -- Ocean Observatories InitiativeTracing Networks -- Craft Traditions in the Ancient Mediterranean and BeyondSENSORIA -- Software Engineering for Service-Oriented Overlay ComputersEventsFORTE 2022COORDINATION 2022Dagstuhl Seminar 21372 "Behavioural Types: Bridging Theory and Practice" Code Beam 2021 (Speaker) Code Mesh 2020 (Speaker) TRENDS 2019 -
